intro: Dugezia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their bell-shaped, yellow or golden flowers that bloom in summer. Dugezia species typically grow in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Their ornamental value makes them popular in gardens and landscaping.
